Package xxl.core.collections.containers

Provides some containers.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Container A Container is the interface implemented by all classes that deal with the management of sets of objects.
 

Class Summary
AbstractContainer An AbstractContainer implements all methods of the Container interface except the central methods get, isUsed, ids, objectIdConverter, remove, reserve, size and update which are abstract.
ConstrainedDecoratorContainer The class provides a constained decorator for a container.
CounterContainer This class decorates a container with a counter functionality and counts every call of an insert, get, update and remove method.
DecoratorContainer The class provides a decorator for a container that follows the Decorator Design Pattern (for further details see Structural Patterns, Decorator in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides).
EmptyContainer This class provides an empty container.
MapContainer This class provides an implementation of the Container interface that internally uses a map to store the (id,*)-elements.
SynchronizedContainer The class provides a synchronized decorator for a container that follows the Decorator Design Pattern (for further details see Structural Patterns, Decorator in Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software by Erich Gamma, Richard Helm, Ralph Johnson, and John Vlissides).
UnmodifiableContainer This class provides a decorator for a given container that cannot be modified.
VerificationContainer Verifies each write operation of a container, that means for example after an insert, the object is retrieved again with get and both objects are compared (using the equals method from Object).
 

Package xxl.core.collections.containers Description

Provides some containers. These are objects that deal with management of a set of objects. In contrast to the Java collections framework, any collection of this framework supports a close method. This methode releases any system resources associated with collection and is very important for collections using external resources like files or JDBC resources.
